statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: UAB 64, St. Louis 62
article.story: ST. LOUIS (AP) -- Donell Taylor scored 27 points as UAB snapped a four-game losing streak by beating Saint Louis 64-62 Wednesday night. Taylor, who entered the game averaging 15.3 points per game, made up for the loss of his twin brother, Ronell, who was out with a broken foot. The Blazers had gone 0-3 since Ronell Taylor's injury. Carldell Johnson had 10 points and five assists for UAB (17-9, 7-6 Conference USA). Izik Ohanon, Ian Vouyoukas and Vas'Shun Newborne all had 12 points each for Saint Louis (7-19, 4-9). The Billikens fell to 4-10 at home, matching the school's single-season record for home losses at the Savvis Center. UAB trailed 57-54 with less than five minutes left when Johnson began to take over. He picked up an assist on Marvett McDonald's 3-pointer that tied the game at 57 with 4:26 left. Johnson then hit a jumper with 3:58 left to give the Blazers a 59-57 lead. UAB never trailed again. The first half was evenly contested, with neither team taking a lead of more than five points. UAB took the largest lead of the half when Demario Eddins converted a layup to make it 17-12. Saint Louis battled back and cut the lead to one at 31-30 when Danny Brown hit a long 3-pointer with 33.8 seconds left in the half.
